question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable and can be displayed. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. The bell rang with a clang, alerting us with its sound.

checklist.title: Is the SVG bell shape accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly represents a bell shape with appropriate curves, dimensions, and proportions. The bell should have a dome shape, a clapper inside, and possibly a mount at the top. Score 0 if no recognizable bell shape is present, 5 if the basic shape is there but lacks detail, and 10 if the bell is accurately portrayed with proper dimensions and elements.

checklist.title: Is the animation for the bell ringing/clanging implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes animation for the bell ringing motion (swinging or vibrating) and potentially for the clapper hitting the bell sides. The animation should be smooth and represent a realistic bell movement. Deduct 5 points if only static elements are implemented, and 3 points if the animation exists but is choppy or unrealistic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are sound effects for the bell clang integrated with the visual?
checklist.description: Verify if the implementation includes audio elements synchronized with the bell animation to produce the 'clang' sound. The audio should trigger appropriately with the visual movement. Deduct 5 points if sound is implemented but not synchronized with the animation, and 10 points if no sound implementation exists at all. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include user interaction to ring the bell?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code allows users to interact with the bell (click, drag, or other interaction methods) to trigger the ringing animation and sound. The interaction should be intuitive and responsive. Deduct 5 points if interaction exists but has noticeable lag or is unintuitive, and 10 points if no interaction is implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, audio loading failures, interaction edge cases, etc.) and provide fallbacks or error handling. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Visual effects like ripples or echoes when the bell rings 2. Multiple bell tones or sounds based on interaction intensity 3. Customizable bell appearance options). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple animation systems operating simultaneously) 2. Function modules unrelated to the bell visualization (e.g., unnecessary UI controls) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle systems or filters). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating SVG definitions, animation logic, and audio handling), code reusability, and optimal use of SVG/JavaScript features. Deduct 5 points if global namespace pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code duplicates functionality unnecessarily; deduct 5 points if inefficient rendering techniques are used. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the bell visualization follows modern design principles: 1) Appropriate use of colors and gradients for a metallic appearance 2) Proper proportions and perspective 3) Attention to details like reflections or textures. Deduct 3 points for unrealistic color choices, 5 points for poor proportions that make the bell unrecognizable, and 5 points for lack of essential visual details. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the animation smooth and realistic?
checklist.description: Judge whether the bell animation conforms to physical characteristics: 1) Natural swinging motion with appropriate easing 2) Realistic timing for the clapper hitting the bell 3) Proper decay in animation intensity over time. Deduct 5 points for jerky or unnatural movement, 3 points for unrealistic timing between visual and audio, and 5 points for animations that don't follow natural physics. The full score is 10 points.
